reasoning: Primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD) type 14 is a genetic subtype caused by mutations in specific ciliary genes. Overall PCD incidence approximately 0.3-0.5 per 100k live births (1 in 20,000 births). Type 14 is a specific genetic variant. Prevalence higher due to chronic nature and improved diagnostic capacity. Confidence moderate due to limited epidemiological data on this specific subtype.
source: Zariwala MA et al. (2007). Genetic heterogeneity of primary ciliary dyskinesia. J Med Genet. 44(11):714-721
